aircraft.value: Ghost Recon - AC-5577-784 at Sector West Station

defect_observed.value: Filter bypass indicator activation. Abnormality observed during system test.

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Steering Control component. Inspection revealed damage to critical components.

corrective_action.value: Replace defective component with serviceable unit from approved stock

preventive_action.value: Reduce inspection interval for affected component type

remarks_investigation.value: Investigation completed as per established procedures. All findings documented.

remarks_design.value: Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions. Date: 28/06/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Quality control procedures verified. Recommend periodic surveillance of manufacturing facility. Date: 29/06/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection. Date: 02/07/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Quality assurance framework assessed. Investigation process followed established protocols. Findings are valid. Date: 02/07/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound. Date: 08/07/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon

FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Mission Critical
b) Defect Observed: Filter bypass indicator activation. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Age-related degradation of elastomeric components
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Steering Control component. Inspection
revealed damage to critical components.
c) Remedial Measures Replace defective component with serviceable unit from approved stock
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Reduce inspection interval for affected component type
